Research Summaries, and Reading Lists

  • My Advanced Exam Reading List
  • Brain Scholl’s Inattentional Blindness List & My Summaries
  • Yury Petrov’s Top 100 Vision Paper List & My Summaries

Manuals, Tutorials, and Documentations

Programming

  • R Basics
    online resource: Eric Nord’s Essential R and Winston Chang’s cookbook for R are good materials to start R.
    book: Paul Teetor’s R Cookbook is an excellent and comprehensive introductory book to start R.
    cheatsheet: If you are familiar with Matlab, this cheatsheet will be very helpful for you to transfer from Matlab/Octave to R.
  • R advanced
    Since R is mainly a programming language for statistical computations, the advanced topics in R programming are related to statistics. Daniel Wollschlaeger’s R Examples Repository has a
  • Python
    Python is another popular language.

Data Analysis, Statistics, and Machine Learning

  • Hypothesis Testing

  • Data Science Courses Resources
    Johns Hopkins University offers a data science specialization track on Coursera.

Neuroimaging

  • (functional) Magnetic Resonance Imaging
    Judy Culham’s fMRI 4 Newbies has a comprehensive list of fMRI related tutorials.

Blogs and Websites

  • My Academic Blog: My Notes and Thoughts on research and others.
  • Matt Might’s Blog: An associate professor of Computer Science. There are lots of useful suggestions from him. Probabily the most famous one is his The illustrated guide to a Ph.D..
  • Terry Tao’s Blog: A blog of a genious mathematician, it’s about math, research, and general suggestions.
  • Philip Guo’s Writing: Thoughts of a computer scientist, and don’t miss his Ph.D. Grind
